ChileCustomerBC - class in this project

ChileCustomerBC.bbj


ChileCustomerBC() - constructor in class ChileCustomerBC

Default constructor. A business component class for customers. It can read, write and delete customers. The default constructor initializes following scopes: A (address), B (basic) and D (default - all fields)


ChileCustomerTableBC - class in this project

ChileCompanyTableBC.bbj


ChileCustomerTableBC() - constructor in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Default constructor. A business component class for customers. It can read, write and delete customers. The default constructor initializes following scopes: A (address), B (basic) and * (default - all fields)


ChileCustomerTableBC(Connection conn!) - constructor in class ChileCustomerTableBC

A business component class for customers. Constructor with an already opened connection and a custom SELECT statement which joined tables. It can read, write and delete customers. This constructor initializes following scopes: A (address), B (basic) and * (default - all fields)

ContextNameInputWindow - class in this project

ContextNameInputWindow(BBjSysGui sysGui!, int x!, int y!, String title!, String btnTitle!) - constructor in class ContextNameInputWindow

createContent(String accept!) - method in class OutputHandler

Creates the output based on the given accept header and returns it as String. The method return an empty String if the content is returned in a different way, for example per file download.

Note: The method throws an !ERROR=406 if the accept header doesn't match any of the supported types.


createDebug() - method in class OutputHandler

Creates a


createHTML() - method in class OutputHandler

Creates the HTML output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to text/HTML to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the HTML format.


createJSON() - method in class OutputHandler

Creates the JSON output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/json to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the JSON format.


createOutput(String accept!) - method in class OutputHandler

This method gets called by the RestBridge.bbj file and is responsible for creating the requested output. The method itself invokes the createContent(String) method and compressed the content returned from that method.

Note: Do not overwrite this method in your custom output handler class, but rather overwrite the createContent(String) method. This method invokes the createContent(String) method and uses the content String returned from it.


createTextXML() - method in class OutputHandler

Creates the JSON output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/JSON to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the JSON format.


createXLSX() - method in class OutputHandler

Creates an Excel(.xlsx) file based on the ResultSet and offers the file for download. The methods sets the response's content type and its headers accordingly to inform the client about the file download.

Note: This method doesn't return raw data in the response but rather provides a file download and therefore doesn't have a return value


createXML() - method in class OutputHandler

Creates the XML output based on the ResultSet, and sets the response's content type header to application/xml to inform the client that the response he's receiving is in the XML format.

getRestBridgeMappingsForContext(String contextName!) - method in class RestBridgeConfigurator

Returns a vector with all mappings of the configured Rest Bridges for the given context. This method is required since it can happen that the Rest Bridge was configured with different mappings multiple time for a same context.

OutputHandler - class in this project

This class is used to convert the BC's return values (ResultSet) into the client requested format. The following types are currently supported:

  • TXT
  • XML
  • HTML
  • JSON
  • XLSX

OutputHandler(BBjNumber debug) - constructor in class OutputHandler

The default constructor used to create an instance of the OutputHandler. The debug value passed to this constructor indicates whether the RESTBridge is running in the debug mode or not.

RestBridgeConfigurator - class in this project

retrieve() - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Retrieves a ResultSet with customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selection is set, it will be used to retrieve the desired fields.


retrieve(BBjInt first%, BBjInt last%) - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Retrieves a ResultSet with a subset of customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selecetion are set, they will be used to retrieve the desired fields.


retrieve() - method in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Retrieves a ResultSet with customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selecetion are set, they will be used to retrieve the desired fields.


retrieve(BBjInt first%, BBjInt last%) - method in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Retrieves a ResultSet with a subset of customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selecetion are set, they will be used to retrieve the desired fields.

setFieldSelection(BBjVector fieldSelection!) - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Set a field selection to retrieve a custom set of fields.


setFilter(DataRow filter!) - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Set a filter to filter the search result. The filter is used in the retrieve method. If no filter is set, the retrieve method will return all customers.


setFilter(DataRow filter!) - method in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Set a filter to filter the search result. The filter is used in the retrieve method. If no filter is set, the retrieve method will return all customers.

setScope(BBjString scope$) - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Set a field selection scope (A, B or D). If no or a wrong scope is set then the default scope (D) will be used.


setScope(BBjString scope$) - method in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Set a field selection scope (f.g. A, B, C, ...). One of the scopes from the scope definition.

V

validateRemove(DataRow dr!) - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be removed. This method is internally used by the remove method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for dependencies before it can be removed.


validateRemove(DataRow dr!) - method in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be removed. This method is internally used by the remove method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for dependencies before it can be removed.


validateWrite(DataRow dr!) - method in class ChileCustomerBC

Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be written. This method is internally used by the write method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for required or missing data.


validateWrite(DataRow dr!) - method in class ChileCustomerTableBC

Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be written. This method is internally used by the write method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for required or missing data.
